sentence.Network_en: Butter, margarine, and oily fish are all good sources of vitamin D.
sentence.Network_cn: 黄油、人造黄油和多脂鱼都含有丰富的维生素D。

sentence.Network_en: As a hangover from rationing, they mixed butter and margarine.
sentence.Network_cn: 作为食品配给制的一种遗留影响，他们总把黄油和人造黄油混在一起吃。

sentence.Network_en: Sunflower margarine has the same fat content as butter.
sentence.Network_cn: 向日葵所制人造黄油的脂肪含量与黄油脂肪含量相同。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: from French, from Greek margaron 'pearl' (because of the lustre of the crystals of esters from which it was first made) + -ine

entry.def: Margarine is a yellow substance made from vegetable oil and animal fats that is similar to butter. You spread it on bread or use it for cooking.

means.word_mean: 1. a spread made chiefly from vegetable oils and used as a substitute for butter

auth_sentence.content: A hard heel of brown bread whitened with margarine.
